title: Birch Trees (Betula spp.)
name: birch trees
rationale: LightGBM provided the best quantitative performance.
description: The birch trees diagnostic species set consists primarily of Betula neoalaskana Sarg., which is common throughout the boreal bioclimatic zone of Alaska and Yukon. Betula kenaica W.H. Evans also occurs in the Alaska Pacific, Alaska-Yukon Southern, and Alaska Southwest vegetation regions, often near the Pacific coast. Betula papyrifera Marshall occurs in Alaska only in the vicinity of Haines. In the past, Betula neoalaskana and Betula kenaica have commonly been considered as belonging within a broad Betula papyrifera. Thus, many of the observations within the map domain of Betula papyrifera refer to Betula neoalaskana or Betula kenaica.
